New Records: Jason Holder took four wickets in four balls, becoming only the fourth bowler in men's T20Is to achieve this feat.
This series featured the most sixes in a bilateral T20I series.
Key Match Events: Jason Holder took 5 wickets for 27 runs, including a four-in-four to seal the match and series.
Akeal Hosein took 4 wickets for 30 runs, significantly contributing to England's collapse.
James Vince scored 55 runs off 35 balls for England.
Kieron Pollard scored 41* off 25 balls for West Indies.
Rovman Powell scored 35* off 17 balls for West Indies.
Adil Rashid took 2 wickets for 17 runs for England.
Liam Livingstone took 2 wickets for 17 runs for England.
Post-Match Reflections: Moeen Ali acknowledged that West Indies were the better team and highlighted the need for improvement in death bowling.
Jason Holder expressed pride in his performance and the support from fans, emphasizing his focus on discipline and death bowling.
Kieron Pollard praised his team's collective effort and resilience, noting the importance of capitalizing in the last four overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, Barbados.
Jason Holder was named Player of the Match and Player of the Series.
